result.execSummary:
The defendant Efren Estrada was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 2 days, Huber privileges for school, work and AODA treatment.
Court makes the defendant eligible to have this case expunged upon successful completion of the sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 3/11/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 3/11/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution set at zero.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral modification course.
No drivers license suspension.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Efren Estrada in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 2 days, Huber privileges for school, work and AODA treatment. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.   
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Complete 20 hours of community service
-No drivers license suspension
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 3/11/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 3/11/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero
**Court makes the defendant eligible to have this case expunged upon successful completion of the sentence
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Efren Estrada in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 3/11/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Efren Estrada in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 01-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Efren Estrada in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
